page.title: 03RELIGION CONTINUED
page.content: The heaviest bell (as in all towers) is called the Tenor and the lightest is called the Treble.The belfry is only about 3metres square. Every year there are about 36 furnerals,12-18 marriges and 36 baptisms.There are 2 services on Sunday,one at 8am which has about 20 people,and one at 11am which has about 60-70 people. The church is about a quarter of a mile up from the Goyt River & Valley.There are 3 houses and a rectory nearby. The rectory was built in 1670 but was enlarged in 1800. The house is huge with 6 bedrooms and a massive entrance hal and kitchen.The present rector is called Darrel Craven Speedy,he has a wife called Mary.They have 4 grown up children and 3 dogs.
